thread.title: SEC Votes to Propose Stricter Broker Standards

author: Dave Michaels
title: SEC Votes to Propose Stricter Broker Standards
text:
Stockbrokers would face tighter restraints on conflicts that can bias investment advice to customers, under a rule proposed Wednesday by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
The SEC’s plan to require brokers act in the best interest of clients is less restrictive than the Labor Department’s “fiduciary rule” affecting retirement accounts that was completed during the last days of the Obama administration, and will likely spark complaints from congressional Democrats and consumer groups that it is too permissive. The SEC’s...
